DataElement.preferredDefinition: The method by which the blood was collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not previously used.: Of, or pertaining to, or contained in, or performing the function of the veins.: A penetrating stab wound from a needle (or other sharp object) that may result in exposure to blood or other body fluids.

Concepts.definition: Of, or pertaining to, or contained in, or performing the function of the veins.
A penetrating stab wound from a needle (or other sharp object) that may result in exposure to blood or other body fluids.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hollow tube that is inserted into a vein.

Concepts.definition: A hollow tube that is inserted into a vein.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The puncture of a vein with a needle for the purpose of drawing blood.

Concepts.definition: The collection of blood from a vein, most commonly via needle venipuncture.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A brand of of test tube specifically designed for venipuncture; the tube contains a vacuum allowing it to suck blood though a needle and fill itself. The tube may contain additives to facilitate downstream processing and testing of the blood samples; the tube cap is color-coded to indicate the type of additive present.

Concepts.definition: A brand of of test tube specifically designed for venipuncture; the tube contains a vacuum allowing it to suck blood though a needle and fill itself. The tube may contain additives to facilitate downstream processing and testing of the blood samples; the tube cap is color-coded to indicate the type of additive present.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
